text: Why doesn't Python have multline comments?
Ok, I'm aware that triple-quotes strings can serve as multiline comments e.g.
But technically speaking these are strings, correct?
I've Googled and read the Python style guide but was unable to find a technical answer to why there is no formal implementation of multiline, /* */ type of comments.
I have no problem using triple quotes, but I am a little curious as to what led to this design decision.
